Class PictureYourSolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • PictureYourSolution

  • public class PictureYourSolution
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be used to display a chess board with eight queens on it, which will serve as the graphical representation of solutions to the eight queens theoretical problem. One such solution is displayed when this program is run. However, that solution is manually programmed in, not found by a method, in the private mySolution() method, as that method simply sets the boolean array to a solution I found not using a computer program. This class will be used by EightQueens to display solutions that that class found using a method. The graphical interface displayed is a JFrame. It has two panels. A header with a JLabel, which has the automatic header text of "My Chess Board," although the header text can be changed. It will also have a grid panel with a GridLayout and 8x8 ChessSquarePanels added to represent the chess board. NOTE: This class used Mrs. Kelly's PracticeGraphics class heavily as a reference.
    Author:
    AnneMarie Caballero (annemariecabs)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PictureYourSolution

        PictureYourSolution​(boolean[][] qs)
        Creates a PictureYourSolution object with a boolean[][] of queens that should represent a viable solution. This sets queens to qs, initializes squares, builds the grid and header panel, and then adds these panels to the window.
        Parameters:
        qs - the solution to be displayed

    • Method Detail

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility​(boolean visible)
        Sets the window panel's visibility
        Parameters:
        visible - if true, sets the JFrame to visible, else makes it disappear

      • resetSquares

        public void resetSquares​(boolean[][] qs)
        Resets the chess board squares using queens, which represents a different solution.
        Parameters:
        qs - the new solution to be displayed, represented as a boolean 2d array

      • resetHeader

        public void resetHeader​(java.lang.String hText)

        Builds the JFrame window to be used including setting its size and layout

      • buildHeaderPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel buildHeaderPanel​()
        Builds and returns a viable headerPanel including instantiating one, setting size and background color, creating and setting the fields of a JPanel, then adding that JPanel in. The JPanel will have the relevant text.
        Returns:
        the header panel

      • buildGridPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel buildGridPanel​()
        Builds and returns the grid panel representing the chess board using the queens field. This will have a GridLayout and have 64 ChessSquarePanels.
        Returns:
        the grid panel

      • getRightColor

        private java.awt.Color getRightColor​(int r,
                                     int c)
        Returns which color should be used for each square on the chess board using the row and column of that square
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the square in question
        c - the column of the square in question
        Returns:
        LIGHT_COLOR for squares on even rows and columns, DARK_COLOR otherwise

      • getRightFlag

        private boolean getRightFlag​(int r,
                             int c)
        Returns whether this square should have a queen on it or not depending on the information in the queens array.
        Parameters:
        r - the row in question
        c - the column in question
        Returns:
        whether there should be a queen on (r, c)

      • mySolution

        private static boolean[][] mySolution​()
        A private method that simply creates a boolean array that represents the first solution that I found, which was found without using a computer program. I used literals because it seemed necessary, as this whole method is a way to avoid using literals in the body of the program.
        Returns:
        the first solution I found (!!)

      • queenToBooleanArray

        public static boolean[][] queenToBooleanArray​(java.util.ArrayList<Queen> queens)
        Converts a Queen ArrayList to a boolean array. Will be used in the Eight Queens class. Mostly a reference method.
        Parameters:
        queens - the Queen ArrayList to be converted
        Returns:
        the boolean[][] that represents the same information as the Queen ArrayList
